channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 1st August
item.description:
28 day with 2 way stop and go plus temporary footway closure please lift and replace x1 broken kerb 500x150x20mm stats required (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 1st August
item.description:

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 1st August
item.description:
Please pass to relevant ahr covering this area. Please send first vegetation letter to St Thomas Catholic Primary school instructing them to cut back overhanging tree branches obstructing the footway along Marsland Road.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Vegetation problem, 1st August
item.description:
28 day with give and take plus temporary footway closure please cut back low hanging tree branches obstructing the footway back to boundary approx 5.5m x 2m x 2.5m (Overgrown Tree)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: TMC - Defects - Kerbs and Channels problem, 1st August
item.description:
28 day with give and take plus temporary footway closure please lift and replace x1 broken radius kerb 900x150x20mm stats required (CW Edge Kerbing & Channels)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 277 priors road, 1st August
item.description:
This drain cover has been reported many times and no one is doing anything about it as they all say it’s nothing to do with them! Do not know where to go from here!!!!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pavement eroded, kerb edge protrudes 1 - 2 inches, 31st July
item.description:
The pavement outside 59 Rosehill Street is eroded and has loose surface, the kerb now protrudes 1 - 2 inches for around 3m+ length. The erosion has occured over many years but as the surface appears to be loose seems to be eroding more quickly. The protruding kerb is now a tripping hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Rosehill Street, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: The traffic lights are not functioning correctly and are causing massive queues in all directions, 31st July
item.description:
Been reported before but you seem to ignore it , considering that it is the school holidays and therefore less works traffic these lights are making it impossible to get out of Wymans Brook
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A1, Kingsditch Lane, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: H box faded , now being ignored by the garage and being parked across., 31st July
item.description:
12 and 14 Kingsmead Road. The problem is on going , been in to complain multiple times and get ignored.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Kingsmead Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road markings, lines and stud issues

item.title: New cycle path installed not flooded before. Now water all over the road to Hare & Hounds PH. It would appear work done constructing the cycle path is either inadequate or damaged the existing infrastructure. Water was coming out of drains., 31st July
item.description:
Generally flood water on the road between Dowty’s and Hare & Hounds PH. Some drains causing water to rise.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wheely bin left outside for a year, 31st July
item.description:
A wheely bin has been left outside 6 Portland Square. It was reported to the council 15 months ago and already has an “environmental crime” sticker on it. It causes an obstruction on the narrow pavement and is a health hazard as it has been used for food waste and now has flies around it,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 11, Portland Square, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Signals heads have rotated., 31st July
item.description:
Whilst waiting at the stop line on the A40 at Arle Court roundabout toward Cheltenham both the lights for A40 and those for travelling around the roundabout are visible. It looks like both signal heads have rotated out of position slightly.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arle Court Roundabout, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Traffic light head is facing wrong direction

item.title: Unfinished panting of yellow lines, 31st July
item.description:
Sheldons Court, Winchcombe Street, Cheltenham Yellow lines should have continued to the gates and around the statue which is where the faded lines go to but they stopped at the speed bump at the entrance.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sheldons Court, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
